user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_str_pct_decode_strict_n_:
```c
size_t
MHD_str_pct_decode_strict_n_ (const char *pct_encoded,
                              size_t pct_encoded_len,
                              char *decoded,
                              size_t buf_size)
{
#ifdef MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE
  bool broken;
  size_t res;

  res = MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_ (pct_encoded, pct_encoded_len, decoded,
                                       buf_size, &broken);
  if (broken)
    return 0;
  return res;
#else  /* ! MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE */
  size_t r;
  size_t w;
  r = 0;
  w = 0;

  if (buf_size >= pct_encoded_len)
  {
    while (r < pct_encoded_len)
    {
      const char chr = pct_encoded[r];
      if ('%' == chr)
      {
        if (2 > pct_encoded_len - r)
          return 0;
        else
        {
          const int h = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
          const int l = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
          unsigned char out;
          if ((0 > h) || (0 > l))
            return 0;
          out =
            (unsigned char) (((uint8_t) (((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) h)) << 4))
                             | ((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) l)));
          decoded[w] = (char) out;
        }
      }
      else
        decoded[w] = chr;
      ++r;
      ++w;
    }
    return w;
  }

  while (r < pct_encoded_len)
  {
    const char chr = pct_encoded[r];
    if (w >= buf_size)
      return 0;
    if ('%' == chr)
    {
      if (2 > pct_encoded_len - r)
        return 0;
      else
      {
        const int h = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
        const int l = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
        unsigned char out;
        if ((0 > h) || (0 > l))
          return 0;
        out =
          (unsigned char) (((uint8_t) (((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) h)) << 4))
                           | ((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) l)));
        decoded[w] = (char) out;
      }
    }
    else
      decoded[w] = chr;
    ++r;
    ++w;
  }
  return w;
#endif /* ! MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE */
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
const int h = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment. The statement calls a separate function toxdigitvalue; this is not a self-call. A MISRA 17.2 violation would only occur if toxdigitvalue (or a function it calls) directly or indirectly called MHD_str_pct_decode_strict_n_, e.g. toxdigitvalue -> helper -> MHD_str_pct_decode_strict_n_, creating recursion.
